poem:
Title: "Upon a Political Scandal's Morning"

A Horizon dark,
split open by ministers – 
a mouthful of denied claims. 
Unripe stories, bitter
as the morning coffee -
stalling post office's disgrace.

In the chair, Henry sits,
limp as the truth revealed, 
shrouded in a cold election's edge.
But, we know - 
each scandal has a season,
ripe in the mouth of time.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ministers deny claims government wanted to stall Post Office Horizon scandal payouts Ministers have denied claims by the former Post Office chair that the government wanted to stall compensation payouts to victims of the Horizon scandal so the Conservatives could “limp into” the general election. Henry Staunton, who was sacked last month by the business secretary, Kemi Badenoch, amid anger over the Horizon scandal, said the request came soon after he took up the role". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
